sweat_loss_calculator.name: Sweat Loss Calculator
sweat_loss_calculator.description: Calculate fluid loss during exercise to optimize hydration strategy
sweat_loss_calculator.purpose: Determine sweat rate for personalized hydration planning

formula.explanation: Total sweat loss accounts for starting weight, ending weight, fluids consumed during activity, and any urine output

input_fields.label: Fluid Consumption Between Weigh-ins
input_fields.description: Total volume of fluids consumed during the exercise session

input_fields.label: Urine Volume
input_fields.description: Volume of urine output during the exercise session (if any)

low.recommendation: Monitor hydration but current intake likely adequate

moderate.recommendation: Ensure regular fluid intake during exercise, aim for 400-800ml per hour

high.recommendation: Prioritize hydration strategy, consume 600-1000ml per hour, consider electrolyte replacement

very_high.recommendation: Implement comprehensive hydration plan with electrolyte supplementation, monitor for signs of dehydration

when_to_measure: Before and after intense training sessions
During different weather conditions (hot, humid, cold)
During different types of workouts (cardio, strength, HIIT)
best_practices: Weigh yourself naked or in minimal clothing for accuracy
Use the same scale for both measurements
Empty bladder before initial weigh-in if possible
Towel off excess moisture before post-workout weigh-in
Perform multiple tests to establish patterns
Test in conditions similar to your typical training environment

hydration_strategy.general_rule: Aim to replace 100-150% of sweat losses in the hours after exercise
hydration_strategy.during_exercise: Replace 60-80% of sweat losses during prolonged activity (>60 minutes)
considerations: Electrolyte needs increase with higher sweat rates
Sweat sodium concentration varies (salty sweaters need more electrolytes)
Acclimatization affects sweat rate and composition

result.recommendation: Aim to consume 900-1200ml of fluid per hour during similar training sessions. Consider electrolyte supplementation.

session_log.notes: Hot and humid conditions, felt very thirsty during workout
session_log.hydration_adequacy: Underhydrated - should have consumed more fluids during session
